intro: Pauletia fusconervis, commonly known as the black-veined pauletia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with prominent dark veins on the petals. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. Pauletia fusconervis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
